saltmarsh 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Creates a token to set up the Google Drive

Source: R/set_up_google_drive.R
set_up_google_drive.Rd

This needs to be run just once for each user of saltmarsh. It sends you to a Google authorization page where you'll need to log in to your Google account, copy a token, and paste it when you're asked to "Enter authorization code."

Usage

set_up_google_drive()

Details

Once this is done, you can verify access with

googledrive::drive_find(n_max = 5)

If you write code that needs to access the Google Drive, you'll need to call the following once per R session. saltmarsh takes care of this–it's only necessary for separate code.

googledrive::drive_auth(token = readRDS('~/.google_auth/google_drive_token.RDS'))

On this page
